description: JSON schema for use in a MongoDb for EarthCube metadata content. Includes metadata elements including history and conformance test information about the metadata record that is independent of the CINERGI pipeline tracking and should be carried in the metadata maintenance section of ISO metdata records.  Default mapping to various input schems will be documented in a defaultMapping file(s). 2015-03-07 SMR; 2015-03-22 SMR add metadata language, character set, change name of resourceDescription section to resourceDocumentation. Version 1.0 superseded unversioned namespace. Add URI for person, organization, keyword

cmd:metadataObject.description: root element; consists of wrapper for archived JSONized version of the initally harvested record and for the metadata content using the CINERGI metadata Object model, along with some data management overhead. The cmd:harvestInformation, cmd:processingStatus, and cmd:metadataProperties are considered the 'document wrapper'.
cmd:metadataObject.cmd:schemaMappingInstructions: Each element that maps to a known input or output information interchange format has a cmd:schemaMapping property that has an object value specifying the mapping target name and uri and the path to the target element in appropriate syntax (JSON path, XPath...)

cmd:primaryKey.description: unique identifier string for this metadataObject

cmd:metadataProperties.description: properties for the metadata record content, should be obtained from the harvest source

cmd:metadataCharacterSet.description: identifier for character set from a Codelist

cmd:characterSetLabel.description: text string for presentation to user, specify characterSet. FOr ISO mapping

cmd:characterSetURI.description: full URI or toke to append to vocabularyURI to get unique identifiery for the identifier

cmd:characterSetVocabularyURI.description: URI for the vocabulary or codelist that defines/contains the identifier

cmd:metadataContact.description: contact information to report problems with the resource description content

items.description: each contact follows the  relatedAgent object template, localized for metadatacontact

cmd:metadataContactRoleURI.description: string to uniquely indentify the agent role for interperability

cmd:metadataContactRoleLabel.description: string that users will understand to present role

cmd:metadataContactRoleVocabularyURI.description: identifier for vocabulary in which the agent role is defined.

cmd:metadataContactAgents.description: Agent as an identifiable object; could be just an organization, or an individual who may or may not be associated with an organization. If the Agent is a person, this should be the same as the PersonURI

cmd:personName.description: The name of an individualformat--Last Name,First name MI

cmd:personURI.description: If we have an external URI for the person, that should go here; otherwise this should be a unique identifier assigned in the CINERGI namespace. At least follow URI syntax (e.g. a prefix for the 'protocol'), even if they are local identifiers.

cmd:personPosition.description: identifies an individual who currently holds the named position in context of an organization

cmd:organizationName.description: this is an array to allow synonyms to be included (acronyms, abbreviations).

cmd:organizationURI.description: unique identifier for organization; use to link to the organization that the person is affiliated with, in the case that the AgentURI is for the person and they have an organization affiliation. In this case the organizationName is equivalent to the linkLabel property

cmd:voicePhoneNumber.description: Number for voice contact. Use registered tel URI scheme for encoding. See http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3966

cmd:faxPhoneNumber.description: Number to send facsimile images. Use registered tel URI scheme for encoding. See http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3966

cmd:contactAddress.description: postal address,ideally formatted appropriate to the target country. One field because there is no clear reason to disaggregate the address into street, city, country, postal code, etc...

cmd:agentInformation.description: text information, providing other details useful for making contact, like hours or ordering instructions

cmd:metadataUpdateDate.description: exactly 1. This is time stamp for most recent change to metadata content in this record. Update history should be in metadataLineage; this is a convienence property

cmd:metadataHarvestedFormat.description: format, version, and profile of original harvested record

cmd:metadataStandardLabel.description: text to inform a person what the harvested format standard was; should indicate name and version if applicable

cmd:metadataStandardURI.description: identifier for standard (including version) of harvested metadata

cmd:metadataProfileLabel.description: text to inform a person what profile the harvested metadata claimed to conform to; should indicate name and version if applicable. If multiple profiles, use pipe '|' delimited string to concatenate

cmd:metadataProfileURI.description: identifier for profile (including version) that harvested metadata claimed conformance with. Pipe delimited list if multiple

cmd:metadataRecordHistory.description: summary statements for processing steps in the document ingestion and processing; detailed provenance history will be recorded in the provenance database; a link is provided to access this history

cmd:processStepStatement.description: text description of how record was processed in this step; what software module was used

cmd:provenanceLink.description: a URL that will retrieve the complete provenance trace for this record from the PROV service

cmd:metadataConformanceTests.description: an array of test names and results, used to indicate quality of record

cmd:conformanceTestNote.description: output from conformance test; if test fails this should provide information about what went wrong

cmd:resourceDocumentation.description: This is the container for the CINERGI metadata object content; was 'data' in Burak's original implementation.  Properties used to document the resource. A profile of the USGIN schema. 2015-03-22 SMR change from resourceDescription to resourceDocumentation to avoid duplicate JSON keys

cmd:resourceTitle.description: Title that identifies the resource for human users. Ideally the title would be unique to the described resource.Preferred title should be first in array. use @xxx suffix to language-localize titles if not English

cmd:resourceDescription.description: Free text description of the resource. May summarize intellectual content, as well as describe various metadata aspects such as lineage, quality, use constraints, maintenance.

cmd:resourceIdentifier.description: Unique identifier conforming to IETF URI syntax (RFC 3986). Resource may have multiple identifiers assigned by different authorities.  preferred identifier recommended by the resource steward. The resourceURI is intended to identify the resource at the FRBR work level. Some identifiers may be associated with particular representations (expressions, manifestations) of the work. E.g. ISBN, ISSN, Dewey Decimal system numbers, or other URIs determined by a publishing authority. Ideally the identifier has a type that can be determined

cmd:resourceURI.description: The resourceURI is intended to identify the resource at the work level.Note citation is to a particular manifestation or expression of the resource; the citationIdentifier is bound to that resource.

cmd:authorityURI.description: string to uniquely indentify the authority for interoperability. An identifier for the authority or identifier scheme within which the Identifier is defined.

cmd:identifierLabel.description: string that users will understand to display identifier in interfaces; should include relevant information about authority and identifier type.

cmd:identifierType.description: A string that specifies the identifier scheme; corresponds to RDA PID type; ideally a URI, but a metadata profile may dictate the vocabulary for identifierTypes. The type specifies what information is associated with the identifier, e.g. dereferencing services, representations of registration information, scope of identified resources.

cmd:resourceIndexTerms.description: an array of objects, each of which is a set of keywords scoped to a particular keywordType or keywordReference value. Only one object in the array should have neither keywordType or keywordReference, and keywords in this element will be treated as free-form tags. 2015-03-07 add URI for keyword, changes object data type from string to object

cmd:keywordTypeLabel.description: label to identify the keyword type in a user interface. type is used to categorize this group of keywords; corresponds to CSDGM and ISO19115 theme. Typical values: include place, temporal, thematic, ISO topic category, ISO19115 hierarchyLevel, ISO19115 hierarchyLevelName etc...

cmd:keywordTypeVocabularyURI.description: identifier for the containing vocabulary (thesaurus, ontology...). Analogous to codelist in ISO19115 or codespace in GML.

cmd:keywordTypeCodespace.description: ISO19139 codespace value for the keywordType

cmd:keywordSourceLabel.description: label to identify thesaurus, controlled vocabulary, ontology, etc. in which the assigned keywords are defined for people

cmd:keywordSourceURI.description: identifier of thesaurus, controlled vocabulary, ontology, etc. in which the assigned keywords are defined, for machiines

cmd:keywordProvenance.description: text identifying the enhancement process used to add or modify keywords in this group. specifies workflow for insertion of keywords added by enhancement

cmd:keywordProvenanceLink.description: link to access a full record for enhancement process from provenance server

cmd:keywords.description: words associated with the resource to improve search accuracy. if no keywordReference is provided, these will be treated as tags. The keyword reference should provide a mapping from the labels that appear as strings in the keywords array here to URIs that uniquely identify the keyword (if such URIs are defined)

items.description: Each keyword may be a tuple of {keyword, keywordURI}, at least one of which MUST be present

cmd:citedSourceAgents.description: intellectual originator and contributors of the resource that metadata record describes.

cmd:citationDates.description: Each date should scope a different origin event

cmd:recommendedCitation.description: a suggested full text citation to use when citing the resource; include standard bibliographic content like edition, publisher, series title, series issue, page numbers, other information appropriate to the described resource

cmd:resourceContacts.description: specification of agent to contact for additional information about the resource. Each relatedAgent has an associated role; various parties may be associated with the resource in different roles.

cmd:resourceContactRoleURI.description: string to uniquely indentify the agent role for interperability

cmd:resourceContactRoleLabel.description: string that users will understand to present role

cmd:resourceContactRoleVocabularyURI.description: identifier for vocabulary in which the agent role is defined.

cmd:resourceContactRoleCodespace.description: ISO19139 codespace value; semantics are unclear, included here for compatibility

cmd:resourceContactAgents.description: Agent as an identifiable object; could be just an organization, or an individual who may or may not be associated with an organization. If the Agent is a person, this should be the same as the PersonURI

cmd:personName.description: The name of an individualformat--Last Name,First name MI

cmd:personURI.description: If we have an external URI for the person, that should go here; otherwise this should be a unique identifier assigned in the CINERGI namespace. At least follow URI syntax (e.g. a prefix for the 'protocol'), even if they are local identifiers.

cmd:personPosition.description: identifies an individual who currently holds the named position in context of an organization

cmd:organizationNames.description: this is an array to allow synonyms to be included (acronyms, abbreviations).

cmd:organizationURI.description: unique identifier for organization; use to link to the organization that the person is affiliated with, in the case that the AgentURI is for the person and they have an organization affiliation. In this case the organizationName is equivalent to the linkLabel property

cmd:voicePhoneNumbers.description: Number for voice contact. Use registered tel URI scheme for encoding. See http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3966

cmd:faxPhoneNumbers.description: Number to send facsimile images. Use registered tel URI scheme for encoding. See http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3966

cmd:contactAddress.description: postal address,ideally formatted appropriate to the target country. Disaggregate the address into street, city, country, postal code, etc... for compatibility with existing metadata specs, but for most (all?) use cases, the whole address could be put in the delivery point

cmd:deliveryPoint.description: street address, PO box.  Full postal address should be in this field if it is not parsed into separate fields.

cmd:administrativeArea.description: name of delivery point state, province, district or other country subdivision

cmd:postalCode.description: postal code for delivery point, using conventions local to the delivery point

cmd:country.description: name of country for delivery point

cmd:agentInformation.description: text information, providing other details useful for making contact, like hours or ordering instructions

cmd:resourceAccessOptions.description: describes how to access the resource described by the metadata. Corresponds to ISO19115 distribution, but restricts options for representation. Each 'distribution' is an accessLinks array element and may be bound to a distributor. Each object in the accessOptions array contains the offerings from a particular distributor

cmd:distributor.description: agent responsible for making the resources accessible at the associated URLs or offline locations

cmd:distributorRoleURI.description: string to uniquely indentify the agent role for interperability

cmd:distributorRoleLabel.description: string that users will understand to present role

cmd:distributorRoleVocabularyURI.description: identifier for vocabulary in which the agent role is defined.

cmd:distributorRoleCodespace.description: ISO19139 codespace value; semantics are unclear, included here for compatibility

cmd:distributorAgents.description: Agent as an identifiable object; could be just an organization, or an individual who may or may not be associated with an organization. If the Agent is a person, this should be the same as the PersonURI

cmd:personName.description: The name of an individualformat--Last Name,First name MI

cmd:personURI.description: If we have an external URI for the person, that should go here; otherwise this should be a unique identifier assigned in the CINERGI namespace. At least follow URI syntax (e.g. a prefix for the 'protocol'), even if they are local identifiers.

cmd:personPosition.description: identifies an individual who currently holds the named position in context of an organization

cmd:organizationNames.description: this is an array to allow synonyms to be included (acronyms, abbreviations).

cmd:organizationURI.description: unique identifier for organization; use to link to the organization that the person is affiliated with, in the case that the AgentURI is for the person and they have an organization affiliation. In this case the organizationName is equivalent to the linkLabel property

cmd:voicePhoneNumbers.description: Number for voice contact. Use registered tel URI scheme for encoding. See http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3966

cmd:faxPhoneNumbers.description: Number to send facsimile images. Use registered tel URI scheme for encoding. See http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3966

cmd:contactAddress.description: postal address,ideally formatted appropriate to the target country. Disaggregate the address into street, city, country, postal code, etc... for compatibility with existing metadata specs, but for most (all?) use cases, the whole address could be put in the delivery point

cmd:deliveryPoint.description: street address, PO box.  Full postal address should be in this field if it is not parsed into separate fields.

cmd:administrativeArea.description: name of delivery point state, province, district or other country subdivision

cmd:postalCode.description: postal code for delivery point, using conventions local to the delivery point

cmd:country.description: name of country for delivery point

cmd:agentInformation.description: text information, providing other details useful for making contact, like hours or ordering instructions

cmd:accessLinks.description: online location that provides some kind of access to the described resource. The link properties are used to characterize the nature of the resource at the specified location.  ***NOTE: need to handle URLs that are templates like OpenSearch templates.

cmd:linkURL.description: a web-derferencable identifier that locates the link target; typically an HTTP URI. URI syntax specifies that the identifier string includes a prefix that specifies the base protocol for the identifier

cmd:linkURLTemplate.description: template for constructing URL; parameter names are in braces; paramaters object contains explanation of parameters

cmd:linkRelations.description: Term from IANA rel vocabulary for consistency with IETF5988. Specifies relationship between resources. Use to assign semantics to the relationship between the linked resources.

cmd:relLabel.description: text to identify the reference in a UI

cmd:relVocabularyURI.description: identifier for vocabulary in which the relLabel is defined.

cmd:relCodespace.description: ISO19139 codespace string for rel type from ISO codelist. Use for codespace from CI_OnLineResource//CI_OnLineFunctionCode

cmd:linkTitle.description: text to label this link in a UI

cmd:linkTargetResourceType.description: typically use MIME type string from IANA registry http : //www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/application/index.html. This is the type of the file that will be accessed directly by the link URL; if this is a container file (e.g. zip archive), the linkContentResourceType property is used to specify the type of file with actual resource content.

cmd:linkContentResourceType.description: File type for the actual resource content. Typically use MIME type string from IANA registry http : //www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/application/index.html

cmd:linkOverlayAPILabel.description: API for messages tunneled to a component on the target server.  Optional, provide if such scheme or protocol is necessary to utilize the link. The URI should be defined by the service specification for the protocol or service type; version information should be included if applicable.  E.g. OGC WMS, WS-services. This property is typically used for services that encode remote procedure calls using identifiers dereferenced using standard HTTP methods (GET, POST). Text to identify the overlay API in a UI

cmd:linkProfileLabel.description: Identifier for profile of specifications identified by type, overlayAPI, and template attributes. Optional, provide if additional conventions are necessary for content contained in messages through this link. Note that the same output scheme might be encoded using different types. Profiles typically add usage conventions when the interchange scheme offers alternate approaches, restrict cardinality for elements in the interchange format, or specify usage of particular vocabularies. Text to identify the profile in a UI

cmd:linkParameters.description: a dictionary (key-value pairs) of other paramters or properties that need to be associated with the link, e.g. WFS feature typeNames, WMS layer names; if a link template is supplied, items should include templateParameter object

cmd:linkParameterLabel.description: string to display, and identifier to link parameter to registry

cmd:linkParameterURI.description: identifier for the parameter from a controlled vocabulary

cmd:linkParameterValue.description: if the parameter is a single value, supply here; if the link is a template this string should express the valid domain for parameter values

cmd:linkParameterDescription.description: text explanation of meaning and usage of parameter

cmd:linkDescription.description: free text description of the target to help UI

cmd:linkTransferSize.description: advisory length of the linked content in octets

cmd:offlineAccess.description: Array of options for accessing the resource or representations of the resource offline-- by ordering digital or analog media containing electronic representations, hard copy representations, or access to a physical resource like a specimen or artifact. Since offline access will always involve human intervention, the orderingInformation element is probably the key element to populate, all the medium, file, and content format stuff might occasionally be used for searches for data in a particular format--probably not for science but for technology testing!

cmd:orderingInformation.description: includes information about how to order, fees required, product identifiers, expected turnaround time, business hours, order end point contact information etc. Also details about the physical characteristics of the resource, information that will be needed to use it, like bit density on media, file size, file compression used. For human consumption--it is offline!

cmd:physicalMediumName.description: text label to convey the physical media  type, e.g. cdROM, dvd, 9trackTape, hardcopy, rockSample, liquidSample, gasSample, core, splitCore, thinSection; need to include version, amendment, or profile identifiers if the format is specific to a particular specification variant

cmd:physicalMediumURI.description: unique Identifer for physical medium, for machine inteoperability; should be registered in a known location

cmd:physicalMediumVocabularyURI.description: unique Identifer for vocabulary in which mediumURI is defined; mediuURI value might be a token that is appended to vocabularyURI to create a resolvable URI for the specific medium

cmd:physicalMediumCodespace.description: ISO19139 codespace value; semantics are unclear, included here for compatibility

cmd:physicalMediumFormatName.description: text label to convey the physical media format type, e.g. cpio, iso9660, highSierra; need to include version, amendment, or profile identifiers if the format is specific to a particular specification variant

cmd:physicalMediumFormatURI.description: unique Identifer for physical format of the distribution medium, for machine inteoperability; should be registered in a known location

cmd:physicalMediumFormatVocabularyURI.description: unique Identifer for vocabulary in which mediumFormatURI is defined; mediuURI value might be a token that is appended to vocabularyURI to create a resolvable URI for the specific medium format

cmd:physicalMediumFormatCodespace.description: ISO19139 codespace value; semantics are unclear, included here for compatibility

cmd:physicalFileFormatName.description: text label to convey file format type, typically specified by a file extension like .pdf, .zip, .tar, .mdb or a MIME type; need to include version and amendment numbers if the format is specific to a particular software version

cmd:physicalFileFormatURI.description: unique Identifer for the file format found on the medium, for machine inteoperability; should be registered in a known location

cmd:contentFormatName.description: If the content is enclosed in the physical file according to some other scheme, that is indicated here. E.g. the file on media is a compressed file, and content is text, or text label to convey file format type. May be  specified by a file extension like .pdf, .zip, .tar, .mdb or MIME type, or might be a specific information exchange profile that specifies the detailed data structure (db-schema, xml schema, rdf vocabulary, csv file spec) of the content; need to include version and amendment numbers if the format is specific to a particular software version

cmd:contentFormatURI.description: unique Identifer for for the format/information structure of the file content, for machine inteoperability; should be registered in a known location

cmd:geographicExtents.description: schema for documenting geographic footprint of a described resource. Constraint: at least one of extentReference, boundingBoxWGS84, extentGeometry or verticalExtent MUST have a valid value.

cmd:extentLabel.description: string to label this extent in UI

cmd:extentTypeName.description: category concept to specify the relationship of the extent to the geographic footprint of the resource, use to distinguish whether the geometry encompasses an area covered by the data or an area where data is not present, or if a point location is provided whether that is a centroid or actual resource location. enumeration: 'within' means resource is within the geometry; 'exclusion' means geometry represents data gap; 'centroid' means location is a point in the central part of location extent; 'point' means extent is a point location (bounding box could be a degenerate polygon, point geomerty should be in the geoJSONgeometry

cmd:extentReference.description: extent could be referenced, but only useful in a system that could follow links to access the actual geometry, or for which the URI is sufficient to match locations.

cmd:referencedExtentLabel.description: label to identify the extent in a user interface; any text that appears here SHOULD also be included as a location keyword. Typically a place name. Notional extents (shoreline, continental shelf, alluvial fan) should be included as theme keywords.

cmd:extentGazetteerURI.description: identifier for the  vocabulary (gazeteer...). Analogous to codelist in ISO19115 or codespace in GML.

cmd:extentGazetteerName.description: name for the containing vocabulary (gazeteer...). A human-recognizable name.

cmd:boundingBoxWGS84.description: simplest representation of geographic extent using latitude and longitude coordinates. Points are represented as degenerate boxes (east = west, north = south bound). Mandate WGS 84 for interoperability. For boxes in polar regions, recommend using geometry property, which allows specification of other SRS appropriate to polar region.

cmd:geoJSONgeometry.description: allow arbitrary geometry object to specify extent. Use GeoJSON encoding. Schema by fge on Github

cmd:verticalExtent.description: Maximum and Minimum Elevations are relative to a datum elevation (based on vertical CRS), which will typically be the Earth surface at the location of the resource or sea level. Datum Elevation must be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL) in meters using EPSG::5714 geodetic parameters (WGS 84). Datum type must be a controlled vocabulary (Earth surface, MSL, Kelly bushing, etc.). The maximum is always numerically greater than the minimum elevation. For boreholes with datum at the earth surface, depth below surface is reported as a negative number.  *Vertical extent may be reported relative to different datum (e.g. sea level, Earth surface) in the same record.  Example: core from borehole at depths between 100 and 470 feet, borehole collar at 4787 feet above sea level.

cmd:verticalCRSLabel.description: label to identify the date type in a user interface

cmd:verticalCRSVocabularyURI.description: identifier for the containing vocabulary (thesaurus, ontology...). Analogous to codelist in ISO19115 or codespace in GML.

cmd:temporalExtents.description: This is the time instant or interval to which the resource content applies. Extent using named time ordinal eras (e.g. geologic time) should be specified using temporal keywords (vocabulary is a time scale). use ISO8601 encoding begin and end are 8601 dateTime strings. see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601

cmd:resourceUsageConstraints.description: properties for specifying legal, technical or security restrictions on the usage or distribution of a resource. Use for DPLA rights properties.

cmd:constraintsStatement.description: free text description of legal, technical, and security-related constraint on access to or use of a resource

cmd:constraintTerms.description: list of all constraints on usage, each categorized by type (security, legal, technical) and specific instance of that constraint type using a controlled vocabulary. Any necessary text elucidation of the constraints should be in the constraintsStatement element

items.description: array of category of constraint e.g.security, access, technical, usage. The controlled concept might

cmd:constrainttypeLabel.description: label to identify the constraint type in a user interface

cmd:constrainttypeVocabularyURI.description: identifier for the containing vocabulary (thesaurus, ontology...). Analogous to codelist in ISO19115 or codespace in GML.

cmd:constraintTerm.description: label to identify the constraint specific value in a user interface

cmd:constraintURI.description: identifier for the particular constraint of constraintType

cmd:constraintVocabularyURI.description: identifier for the containing vocabulary (thesaurus, ontology...). Analogous to codelist in ISO19115 or codespace in GML.

cmd:licenses.description: specification of one or more licenses that applies to the resource. Complete statement of license should be put in the constraintsStatement key if it is desired to include in the metadata

cmd:licenseURI.description: identifier for the license. should derfenrnce to some kind of statement of license

cmd:licenseName.description: Name used to identify the license to users

cmd:resourceBrowseGraphic.description: Reference that specifies a graphic resource that provides a visualization of the resource, as well as a URL link that should access the graphic.

cmd:resourceBrowseGraphicURL.description: a web-derferencable identifier that locates the link target; typically an HTTP URI. URI syntax specifies that the identifier string includes a prefix that specifies the base protocol for the identifier

cmd:linkRelations.description: Term from IANA rel vocabulary for consistency with IETF5988. Specifies relationship between resources and or

cmd:linkRelationLabel.description: label to identify the link relation in a user interface

cmd:linkRelationVocabularyURI.description: identifier for the containing vocabulary (thesaurus, ontology...). Analogous to codelist in ISO19115 or codespace in GML.

cmd:linkTitle.description: text to label this link in a UI

cmd:linkContentResourceType.description: File type for the actual resource content. Typically use MIME type string from IANA registry http : //www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/application/index.html

cmd:resourceLanguages.description: Language of resource content. Multiple languages may be specified. Use Nil not applicable if there is no text in the resource. Use ISO three letter language code (Each language SHOULD be expressed as a language tag, as defined by RFC 3066); provide option to use a cmd:reference if need some other kind of language scoping

cmd:resourceLanguageLabel.description: label to identify the language of resource content in a user interface

cmd:resourceLanguageVocabularyURI.description: identifier for the containing vocabulary (thesaurus, ontology...). Analogous to codelist in ISO19115 or codespace in GML.

cmd:resourceSpatialDescription.description: Properties characterizing the spatial aspects of the resource, if applicable. Allow multiple extents for non contiguous resource, e.g. map of US coasts.

cmd:resourceSpatialRepresentationType.description: term specifying the nature of the geometric representation, e.g. vector, grid, tin, voxel. More complete information on spatial representation (like ISO19115 spatial representation package) is not included here; use extensions in the description details group

cmd:resourceSpatialRepresentationTypeLab.description: label to identify the Spatial Representation type in a user interface

cmd:resourceSpatialRepresentationTypeURI.description: identifier for resource Spatial Representation type

cmd:resourceSpatialRepresentationTypeVoc.description: identifier for the containing vocabulary (thesaurus, ontology...). Analogous to codelist in ISO19115 or codespace in GML.

cmd:resourceSpatialReferenceSystem.description: identifier and link to definition of spatial reference system used for location information contained in the resource content

cmd:resourceSpatialReferenceSystemLabel.description: label to identify the spaatial reference system in a user interface

cmd:resourceSpatialReferenceSystemURI.description: identifier for resource spatial reference system

cmd:resourceSpatialReferenceSystemVocabu.description: identifier for the containing vocabulary (thesaurus, ontology...). Analogous to codelist in ISO19115 or codespace in GML.

cmd:resourceInformationModel.description: documentation of the information item types (DataType) and content semantics of structured data resources. Discrete coverage, quantitiative imagery, geospatial features. Synthesis of ISO19115-1, ISO19115-2, CSDGM, ISO11179. Each record or object in a dataset is about some entity. Each record is a description of an instance of the entity in some context, which may be spatial, temporal, or some other independent variable. In the O&M model, the 'entity' corresponds to the feature of interest, and the 'context' corresponds to a sampling feature. The content in this metadata section is focused on the semantics of the data in a dataset, useful for discovery of information of interest. Documentation of encoding, file structure, syntax are handled elsewhere (extras for now). The details of encoding, grid geometry, numeric resolution, and information exchange syntax are particular to each accessOption (distribution) of the dataset. The informaiton model should apply to all distributions.

cmd:localEntityName.description: the name for this data entity, table, object or feature used in the described data resource

cmd:dataTypeName.description: Name of this information item, may be registered in a data type registry (c.f. RDA DataTypes).

cmd:dataTypeURI.description: unique global identifier that can be dereferenced to establish equivalence or link to the data type specification. Identity of a data type is based on the set of allowed attributes, and the range of subject entities that that dataType is used to describe. The registered data type might be used to bring in the description of the data type instead of including in line

cmd:entityOfInterestName.description: name of the domain domain entity (feature) that is the subject of the information in members (records, objects) in a dataset. Example geologic unit, aquifer, Earth surface, river, lake, weather front, ocean current. The feature of interest carries properties that are quantified by some observation process operating on each sampling feature instance

cmd:entityOfInterestURI.description: unique identifier for the doamin entity that is the subject of the data.

cmd:entityOfInterestDescription.description: free text description of the entity or feature of interest

cmd:samplingBasisName.description: name of the entity (samplingFeature) that is the basis for assigning property values to the feature of interest. Examples include borehole interval, ground sampling cell (for a remote sensing image), outcrop station, rock sample, outcrop area, instrument, aggregation (of other data). The spatial representation section describes how the sampling features are geolocated

cmd:samplingBasisURI.description: unique identifier for the samplingFeature or other sampling basis entity.

cmd:samplingBasisDescription.description: free text description of what was the basis for determining data values describing the entity(feature) of interest that is the subject of this data

cmd:attributes.description: This array documents the vector of properties that may be quantified for each data item instance.

cmd:attributeLabel.description: Label used to identify this attribute in this data resource

cmd:attributeURI.description: unique identifier for this attribute. Identity based on phenomenon, contentType, Domain definitions; if the type is registered, these properties can be inherited from the registry, so only the attribute properties specific to this resource need be explicitly included in this metadata record

cmd:attributeContentTypeLabel.description: Categorization of the kind of information specified by this attribute, based on ISO19115 CoverageContentType, examples (from ISO19115-1): image, thematicClassification, physicalMeasurement,auxilliaryInformation, qualityInformation,referenceInformation, modelResult, coordinate. Value of 'group' indicates that this attribute instance is defining an attribute group, the attributeURI will be used to group other attributes in this group.

cmd:attributeContentTypeURI.description: unique identifier for the ContentType, a categorization of the kind of information specified by this attribute, based on ISO19115 CoverageContentType, examples (from ISO19115-1): image, thematicClassification, physicalMeasurement,auxilliaryInformation, qualityInformation,referenceInformation, modelResult, coordinate. Value of 'group' indicates that this attribute instance is defining an attribute group, the attributeURI will be used to group other attributes in this group.

cmd:attributeContentTypeVocabularyURI.description: Unique identifier for the vocabulary within which the content type is identified; if the ContentTypeURI identifier type allows resolution of the vocabulary, this is redundant; for some schemes the TypeURI value may be a toke that is appended to the vocabulary URI to obtain the full TypeURI

cmd:attributeContentTypeCodespace.description: Codespace identifier for the contentType, for compatibility with ISO19115

cmd:attributePhenomenonName.description: name of the physical phenomenon quantified by this attribute, e.g. fluid flux, planar geospatial orientation, density, velocity.

cmd:attributePhenomenonURI.description: a registered identifier that uniquely specifies the physical phenomenon quantified by the attribute, for interoperability and linked data

cmd:attributeGroupURI.description: document a group definition as a separate attribute, requires an assigned attributeURI for the group, then use that URI here to aggregate attributes in a group. The GroupURI may be externally defined, but the URI must dereference to provide an explanation of the group.

cmd:attributeDescription.description: text description of the attribute characteristics

cmd:attributeMeasurementUnitsName.description: name of the unit of measure used to quantify the attribure

cmd:attributeMeasurementUnitsURI.description: Identifier for the units of measure from some registry, for interoperability

cmd:attributeDomainVocabularyName.description: part of a data type definition, defines the allowed values that may appear in valid attribute instances

cmd:attributeDomainVocabularyURI.description: Unique idnetiifer for the vocabulary from which values for the attribute are assigned

cmd:attributeTermEnumeration.description: an array of values that actually appear in the data that quantify this attribute; applies to attributes that have term values that may be user-supplied (not controlled) or from a controlled vocabulary, in which case the values should be consistent withthe attributeVocabulary spcified in the attributeDomain element.

cmd:attributeNumericMinimum.description: The minimum numeric value that occurs in this attribute in the described data; the attribute must have a numeric data type. The attributeMeasurementUnits must have a valid UOM value, and that value MUST apply to the minimum and maximum specified here

cmd:attributeNumericMaximum.description: The maximum numeric value that occurs in this attribute in the described data; the attribute must have a numeric data type. The attributeMeasurementUnits must have a valid UOM value, and that value MUST apply to the minimum and maximum specified here

cmd:attributeNumberOfValues.description: count of the number of data instances that have valid values for this attribute

cmd:attributeMeanValue.description: The mean of the valid numeric values that occur in this attribute in the described data; the attribute must have a numeric data type. The attributeMeasurementUnits must have a valid UOM value, and that value MUST apply to the value specified here

cmd:attributeStandardDeviation.description: The standard deviation of the valid numeric values that occur in this attribute in the described data; the attribute must have a numeric data type. The attributeMeasurementUnits must have a valid UOM value, and that value MUST apply to the value specified here

cmd:attributeQuantityType.description: kind of quantifier used to specify values for the attribute. Example values: count, boolean, category (controlled or ad hoc), number (includes magnitude, ratio, coordinate), DateTime, free text

cmd:attributeQuantityTypeURI.description: Unique identifier, ideally from a registry, for  the kind of quantifier used to specify values for the attribute. For interoperability. Example values: count, boolean, category (controlled or ad hoc), number (includes magnitude, ratio, coordinate), DateTime, free text. A registered vocabulary of standard quantity types needs to be identified.

cmd:attributeAcquisitionDescription.description: free text description of the observation procedure, including instrument details, measurement protocols, environmental conditions, etc., content from MI_AcquitisionInformation (ISO19115-2), MD_ImageDescription (ISO19115) specific to the attribute values in the described data resource. Not detailed here because the information is very domain and data specific

cmd:attributeAcquisition.description: Structured object documenting the observation procedure for machine clients, including instrument details, measurement protocols, environmental conditions, etc., content from MI_AcquitisionInformation (ISO19115-2), MD_ImageDescription (ISO19115) specific to the attribute values in the described data resource. Not detailed here because the information is very domain and data specific

cmd:relatedResources.description: links to related resources. The relation property on the link defines the association type, and the link label provides the related resource name

cmd:extras.description: this is a wrapper element for additional content that is not in the source document, and does not map to the CINERGI metadata Object but that needs to be included in the  MongoDB records. any properties can be added here. Content in the source document that does not map to the MongoDb Metadata Object should be accessed in the JSONized source document that is in the sourceDocument key of the processing section (cpo:).

cmd:relatedAgent.description: this is a pattern that is used in several places. Needs to be mapped to FOAF agent, with an associated role. The scheme has been worked over to minimize nesting and simplify.

cmd:agentRoleURI.description: string to uniquely indentify the agent role for interperability

cmd:agentRoleLabel.description: string that users will understand to present role

cmd:agentRoleVocabularyURI.description: identifier for vocabulary in which the agent role is defined.

cmd:agentRoleCodespace.description: ISO19139 codespace value; semantics are unclear, included here for compatibility

cmd:agents.description: Agent as an identifiable object; could be just an organization, or an individual who may or may not be associated with an organization. If the Agent is a person, this should be the same as the PersonURI

cmd:personName.description: The name of an individualformat--Last Name,First name MI

cmd:personURI.description: If we have an external URI for the person, that should go here; otherwise this should be a unique identifier assigned in the CINERGI namespace. At least follow URI syntax (e.g. a prefix for the 'protocol'), even if they are local identifiers.

cmd:personPosition.description: identifies an individual who currently holds the named position in context of an organization

cmd:organizationNames.description: this is an array to allow synonyms to be included (acronyms, abbreviations).

cmd:organizationURI.description: unique identifier for organization; use to link to the organization that the person is affiliated with, in the case that the AgentURI is for the person and they have an organization affiliation. In this case the organizationName is equivalent to the linkLabel property

cmd:voicePhoneNumbers.description: Number for voice contact. Use registered tel URI scheme for encoding. See http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3966

cmd:faxPhoneNumbers.description: Number to send facsimile images. Use registered tel URI scheme for encoding. See http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3966

cmd:contactAddress.description: postal address,ideally formatted appropriate to the target country. Disaggregate the address into street, city, country, postal code, etc... for compatibility with existing metadata specs, but for most (all?) use cases, the whole address could be put in the delivery point

cmd:deliveryPoint.description: street address, PO box.  Full postal address should be in this field if it is not parsed into separate fields.

cmd:administrativeArea.description: name of delivery point state, province, district or other country subdivision

cmd:postalCode.description: postal code for delivery point, using conventions local to the delivery point

cmd:country.description: name of country for delivery point

cmd:agentInformation.description: text information, providing other details useful for making contact, like hours or ordering instructions

cmd:LinkObject.description: used for situations that need a link (hypermedia affordance) to an online resource, typically for navigating linked data space.  The link is a locator--an identifier for a location that can provide a digital object.

cmd:linkURL.description: a web-derferencable identifier that locates the link target; typically an HTTP URI. URI syntax specifies that the identifier string includes a prefix that specifies the base protocol for the identifier

cmd:linkRelations.description: Term from IANA rel vocabulary for consistency with IETF5988. Specifies relationship between resources. Use to assign semantics to the relationship between the linked resources.

cmd:relLabel.description: text to identify the reference in a UI

cmd:relVocabularyURI.description: identifier for vocabulary in which the relLabel is defined.

cmd:relCodespace.description: ISO19139 codespace string for rel type from ISO codelist. Use for codespace from CI_OnLineResource//CI_OnLineFunctionCode

cmd:linkTitle.description: text to label this link in a UI

cmd:linkTargetResourceType.description: typically use MIME type string from IANA registry http : //www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/application/index.html. This is the type of the file that will be accessed directly by the link URL; if this is a container file (e.g. zip archive), the linkContentResourceType property is used to specify the type of file with actual resource content.

cmd:linkContentResourceType.description: File type for the actual resource content. Typically use MIME type string from IANA registry http : //www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/application/index.html

cmd:linkOverlayAPILabel.description: API for messages tunneled to a component on the target server.  Optional, provide if such scheme or protocol is necessary to utilize the link. The URI should be defined by the service specification for the protocol or service type; version information should be included if applicable.  E.g. OGC WMS, WS-services. This property is typically used for services that encode remote procedure calls using identifiers dereferenced using standard HTTP methods (GET, POST). Text to identify the overlay API in a UI

cmd:linkProfileLabel.description: Identifier for profile of specifications identified by type, overlayAPI, and template attributes. Optional, provide if additional conventions are necessary for content contained in messages through this link. Note that the same output scheme might be encoded using different types. Profiles typically add usage conventions when the interchange scheme offers alternate approaches, restrict cardinality for elements in the interchange format, or specify usage of particular vocabularies. Text to identify the profile in a UI

cmd:linkParameters.description: a dictionary (key-value pairs) of other paramters or properties that need to be associated with the link, e.g. WFS feature typeNames, WMS layer names

cmd:linkParameterLabel.description: string to display, and identifier to link parameter to registry

cmd:linkParameterURI.description: identifier for the parameter from a controlled vocabulary

cmd:linkDescription.description: free text description of the target to help UI

cmd:linkTransferSize.description: advisory length of the linked content in octets

cmd:dateTypeLabel.description: label to identify the date type in a user interface

cmd:dateTypeVocabularyURI.description: identifier for the containing vocabulary (thesaurus, ontology...). Analogous to codelist in ISO19115 or codespace in GML.

cmd:dateTypeCodespace.description: text string for ISO19139 codespace  value.
